intro: Buphthalmum odorum, commonly known as the sweet William of the desert, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Its flowers are often fragrant, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss.
